header.title: User Blog Mod Change Blog Path
header.description: Changes the path at which the blogs are displayed on your website.

action-group.diy-instructions:
1. Copy the files from Change Blog Path/ to the place where you want the blog to be shown.
2. If there is a .htaccess file in the directory you are copying this to, follow the 2a instructions, else follow the 2b instructions. 2a. Open the .htaccess file and search for "RewriteEngine on". If it is not in the file add the following code to the bottom of the file: RewriteEngine on
Rewriterule ^blog/(.+)/(.+).html$ ./blog/view/blog.php?page=$1&mode=$2 Rewriterule ^blog/(.+).html$ ./blog/blog.php?page=$1 Rewriterule ^blog/(.+)/$ ./blog/view/blog.php?page=$1 Rewriterule ^blog/$ ./blog/blog.php
Else, if "RewriteEngine on" is in the .htaccess file already, add the following code to the bottom of the file: Rewriterule ^blog/(.+)/(.+).html$ ./blog/view/blog.php?page=$1&mode=$2 Rewriterule ^blog/(.+).html$ ./blog/blog.php?page=$1 Rewriterule ^blog/(.+)/$ ./blog/view/blog.php?page=$1 Rewriterule ^blog/$ ./blog/blog.php
2b. Create a file named .htaccess in the directory and add the following code to it: RewriteEngine on
Rewriterule ^blog/(.+)/(.+).html$ ./blog/view/blog.php?page=$1&mode=$2 Rewriterule ^blog/(.+).html$ ./blog/blog.php?page=$1 Rewriterule ^blog/(.+)/$ ./blog/view/blog.php?page=$1 Rewriterule ^blog/$ ./blog/blog.php
3. In the directory you copied the files to, open blog.php, blog/blog.php, and blog/view/blog.php. Then change the defined PHPBB_ROOT_PATH to the relative path to youre phpBB3 forum.
4. Open config.php in your forum's root directory. Find: @define('PHPBB_INSTALLED', true);
After, Add: @define('BLOG_ROOT', '');
Change the '' to hold the path relative from your domain where you would like to have the blog shown, '' for yoursite/blog/, 'home/' for yoursite/home/blog/, etc.
